snippet: The Obama administration is concerned that 60 million are shut out of jobs, government services, health care and education, and that the economic effects are looming larger.
abstract: Nearly 98 percent of American homes now have access to some form of high-speed broadband since Obama administration has poured billions into expanding reach of Internet, but tens of millions of people are still not connected; digital divide means scores of people are shut out of jobs, government services, health care and educations, amounting to looming economic consequences.

byline.contributor: Cynthia Howle, Glenny Brock and Alan Blinder contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is concerned that 60 million are shut out of jobs, government services, health care and education, and that the economic effects are looming larger.

headline.main: Most of U.S. Is Wired, but Millions Aren’t Plugged In
headline.print_headline: Most of U.S. Is Wired, but Millions Aren’t Plugged In
